												Better then the first game, and the best pc version of any Cars.  Lets get to the good. It runs at 60fps(unlike the orginal), and it features much higher quality textures. The racing is fun and the open hub world is great to have. This is like an expansion on the first game that makes the original almost useless. Then there is modding, but I will get to that. That gets me to the problems that do not make sense... First it does not support 1080p(The 1st did) on my screen, however my laptop runs at 1080 fine,and the 360 rotation is terribly touchy. As for the graphics options there are not any really. Typical Disney port. Though you would really need a paper weight to struggle running this. Then theres a little known glitch where if you're running it off of fast HDD hybrid(32+GB cache) the sound will glitch and the game will freeze for a half second to catch up. So run this off of a slower hybird, normal HDD, or SSD. I am running it on an SSD and it runs great. On top of that Chick Hicks is gone, among others from the movie like DJ and King. That gets me to best thing about this game.  A mod called High Octaine. It puts all the big characters in this and adds many new tracks. You can pick Snot Rod, Cartrip, Wingo, Lizzy,and Fred. Freaking Fred! And many more. It even adds McQueen and Matrer from Matters Tall Tales as well as Mia and Tia wearing different costumes from Tall Tales. I have yet to get a crash and everythings buttery smooth even though it is not widescreen. If you go to your graphic control pannel you can increase and enhance everything; so don't be afraid of messing around with things like texture qulity and set AF x16. Like wise Sweet Fx works great enhancing the draw distance, lighting and colors. Go to Nexus and download Sweet Fx mod for Assassins Creed Rouge and drop it in with the exe. Its a great preset and doesn't require any tweeking if you don't want to. With all that in place it is the most visually impressive Cars game anywhere with the most content. If your kids like Cars, then this is the version to get on PC hands down. None of the mods take much work and the game runs very well.

												The first game is better in my opinion, but this game is not so bad.The visuals look "shiny and glossy" compared to the graphics of the first game. The first game's graphics really gave off the vibe that the first movie had. That being said, this game's graphics aren't necessarily bad.The hub worlds look great, are redesigned from the first game (Ornament Valley is now an airport and has new area to drive in). However, some areas that were normally accessible in the first game are now blocked off in the second.The races are very fun and enjoyable. If you're an older gamer though, you might find them a little easy.The one exception to this is "Inside the Turkey" which is a mess of a track, very confusing, hard to see. Whether intentional or not, you really feel like you are driving inside a turkey.The music is fine, but none of the catchy songs with lyrics from the first game get reused. We do get "Life is a Highway" from the movie.Controls can be modified in the options menu, and shouldn't take more than five minutes to set up. You can also input cheats in the options menu (unlock all cars, all content etc.)The game's story is not very long, I beat it in five hours not including some side minigames/races that were not super important. After beating the story, the only replayability you really have is if you want to do some racing on tracks that you have already beat.The writing of the dialogue in this game doesn't really have the feel that the Cars movie had. The writing of the first game definitely had more humor, and was overall better.All in all, I wouldn't recommend buying this game at full price, but maybe on a sale. If you want to go for the first game, you can try your luck with the Steam port, and if that doesn't work for you, the game is also on PS2, Gamecube, and some other platforms I believe.7/10
